image.altText: Treasurer Jim Chalmers in the corridors of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The treasurer is set to manage the expectations of a larger surplus in a pre-budget address, warning a decline in iron ore prices and a softening labour market will impact the bottom line.

title.children: Treasurer Jim Chalmers to temper great surplus expectations in pre-budget speech

image.altText: A worker in high-viz and hardhat in a well-lit underground cavern.

props.synopsis: Emergency services are working to free the last of 27 miners trapped in the Ballarat Gold Mine after a rockfall on Wednesday afternoon.

title.children: 26 miners rescued, one still trapped after rockfall in Ballarat Gold Mine

image.altText: An aerial image of a car and seven people in the bush

props.synopsis: Seven people have been found alive after becoming stranded for days in Western Australia's flooded outback.

title.children: Missing group found alive after becoming stranded in WA's flood-stricken outback

image.altText: A garbage truck with fire.

props.synopsis: Lithium-ion batteries have been responsible for more than 1,000 fires during the past year in Australia. Industry and government want regulation and action.

title.children: 'Large exothermic reaction': Why your exposed batteries are causing hundreds of fires

image.altText: Black and white wedding photo of murder victim Kelly Wilkinson smiling.

props.synopsis: A man who repeatedly stabbed his estranged wife, then set her on fire in her backyard on the Gold Coast almost three years ago, has been jailed for life.

title.children: 'You brutally killed her': Kelly Wilkinson's estranged husband sentenced to life in jail

image.altText: The outside of a Bunnings store in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Bunnings' monopoly over the gardening sector has prompted calls for the retail giant to face the same scrutiny as Australia's two major supermarkets.

title.children: Commercial gardeners and growers 'scared of retribution' question Bunnings' market power

image.altText: Composite of Finnish woman with short hair wearing a wool sweater and a blonde Australian woman holding a toddler.

props.synopsis: Australia's childcare system has been described as a "ridiculous struggle" for many working families, but could a country a world away teach us how to do it right?

title.children: While Aussies beg for babysitters on Facebook, child care in Finland is guaranteed by the government

image.altText: a man holding a child and hugging a woman

props.synopsis: Mariam Raad was arrested in January 2023 and charged with entering or remaining in an area controlled by the Islamic State group.

title.children: ISIS wife who returned to Australia expected to enter plea, sentencing set for June

image.altText: A man standing out the front of a Service SA sign.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man who falsely tested positive on a roadside drug screening has been issued a three-month loss of licence, despite official results revealing he was not driving under the influence.

title.children: 'The stress level is absolutely beyond': Man loses licence after false positive drug test

image.altText: A crowd of people walk across the street in masks, including an older couple.

props.synopsis: Australia was one of the only countries to record an increase in life expectancy from 2019 to 2021, demonstrating the "relative success" of Australia's handling of the pandemic, an infectious diseases expert says.

title.children: Global life expectancy fell by 1.6 years during the COVID-19 pandemic but Australia bucked the trend

image.altText: A man in a dark suit stands outside, surrounded by journalists.

props.synopsis: In a statement issued outside the Newcastle Local Court, Brett Button said he was "devastated" by the 2023 crash.

title.children: 'I am devastated': Hunter Valley bus driver 'truly sorry' over crash after wedding that left 10 dead

image.altText: A blonde woman wearing a purple top talks into a microphone

props.synopsis: A former Australian Defence Force psychological examiner who was medically discharged says she would still be serving today if she had been offered adequate support and care.

title.children: Former psychological examiner tells royal commission ADF did not offer her adequate care and support

image.altText: Rainbow flag

props.synopsis: A bill to ban gay conversion therapy will be introduced to NSW parliament today, with allowances made for parents and religious sermons.

title.children: NSW government says its plan to ban gay conversion therapy will 'save lives'. This is what it's planning to do

image.altText: People mooning the Ghan.

props.synopsis: Twenty years after baring their bums for the first time, old-time mooners have been joined by many first-timers to welcome passengers of the iconic tourist train The Ghan as it approaches Darwin.

title.children: 'Get your backside trackside': Hundreds moon The Ghan in territory tradition

image.altText: A hand from the west of Australia clenches its fist over money while a hand from the east asks for more

props.synopsis: Like clockwork, the release of the draft GST split has set off bickering and recriminations among state treasurers. How is the money split up and why is it so controversial?

title.children: How is GST split up and why does it cause an annual argument?

image.altText: Rohan Dennis walking outside court

props.synopsis: Former professional cyclist Rohan Dennis has faced court for the first time since being charged with causing the death of his Olympian wife Melissa Hoskins, with prosecutors requesting time to complete a major crash reconstruction.

title.children: Rohan Dennis faces court charged with causing death of Olympian wife Melissa Hoskins

image.altText: A vertically oriented explosion is visible against a backdrop of ocean and forested mountainside.

props.synopsis: The 18-metre, four-stage solid-fuel rocket exploded seconds after lifting off just after 11:01am, leaving behind a large cloud of smoke, fire, and fragments of the rocket.

title.children: Japanese company Space One's Kairos rocket explodes just seconds after launch

image.altText: A man and his smiling wife.

props.synopsis: A Victorian survivor of abuse and sexual violence has spoken out after her former husband was sentenced over the horror she endured at his hands.

title.children: Former White Ribbon ambassador jailed for raping wife

image.altText: A hand holds up a phone with a Wordle game seen on the screen

props.synopsis: The newspaper is fighting off Wordle "clones" with takedown notices, arguing that numerous games inspired by its mega-popular word-guessing game infringe on its copyright protections.

title.children: The New York Times sends takedown notices to Wordle look-alike games

image.altText: A group of people mainly dressed in orange wave and smile.

props.synopsis: Thailand's Election Commission announces it will ask Thailand's Constitutional Court to disband the Move Forward Party over concerns the party's campaign to change a law against insulting the monarchy undermines the country's system of governance.

title.children: 'Not at all surprising': Party that won Thailand's election set to be dissolved

image.altText: A man stands in a concrete cityscape with white headphones in and a grey shirt on.

props.synopsis: Estimates that bots bought up to 30 per cent of the tickets to Fred again..'s seven arena shows are "unsubstantiated and refuted", Ticketek says. But the 'botters' themselves claim the number is much higher.

title.children: An expert estimated 20 per cent of Fred again.. tickets were bought by bots. The botters brag it's way more

image.altText: Man in suit outside court

props.synopsis: Peter Lang, who was a prominent radio host on the Sunshine Coast, has been found guilty of charges including carnal knowledge of a girl under 16.

title.children: Former Queensland radio host found guilty of historical sexual offences against girl

image.altText: A small grey-brown squirrel crouches low on the ground amongst a layer of leaves.

props.synopsis: The plague occurs naturally in rural parts of the western United States, where it is carried by wild rodents including rock squirrels, wood rats, chipmunks, mice and rabbits.

title.children: New Mexico man dies of the plague, in the US state's first fatal case of the disease since 2020

image.altText: Admiral Jonathan Mead watches a Virginia-class submarine on the water.

props.synopsis: Defence Minister Richard Marles insists AUKUS partners are working "at pace" to help Australia acquire nuclear-powered submarines after the United States revealed it would halve next year's planned production of Virginia-class boats.

title.children: Former PM Malcolm Turnbull says Australians 'mugged by AUKUS reality' as US plans to halve submarine production

image.altText: Grape grower Jack Papageorgiou

props.synopsis: Chinese authorities have announced an interim decision that tariffs of 220 per cent on Australian wine are no longer necessary, but the industry doesn't see a return to the market fixing its crisis.

title.children: 'Tank farms' a stark reality of Australia's wine industry crisis even if China drops tariffs

image.altText: Sun in an orange sky overlooking a wharf

props.synopsis: After a hot and humid summer, NSW is now enduring an extended spell of warm autumn weather moving into its second week.

title.children: Sydney's waters now warm enough for a tropical cyclone

image.altText: A woman laying down face up on a beige couch with yellow woolen cardigan, and hands covering her face.

props.synopsis: Coeliac disease can have significant long-term health impacts but most people living with the condition don't know they have it. There are some simple steps to take if you think you're one of them.

title.children: Most people with coeliac disease don't know they have it. Here are the signs to look out for

image.altText: A young man.

props.synopsis: After a 17-year search for answers, Bill and Cheryl McCormack are pinning their hopes on advancements in DNA testing and video software in the hunt for their son Shannon's killer.

title.children: Parents of 22-year-old who died after one-punch attack look to new technology to find son's killer

image.altText: Jimmy Cherizier

props.synopsis: Haiti's prime minister has resigned after gangs torched and stormed prisons. This is what we know about one of the key leaders and what the future holds.

title.children: What we know about Haiti gang leader Jimmy Chérizier known as 'Barbecue'

image.altText: A surfer, wearing Australian and Japanese flags on his outfit, uses his hand to steady himself as he moves through a big wave.

props.synopsis: Surfer Connor O'Leary grew up in Cronulla, but when he takes to his board in Teahupo'o for the Paris Olympics, he will be representing Japan, his mother's native country.

title.children: Japan picks Aussie-born O'Leary for Olympics surfing spot
